intro: Dianthus impunctatus, commonly known as the pink rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers with five petals. Its flowers are often described as having a delicate, almost fragrant scent. Dianthus impunctatus thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas.
